intro: Horkelia argyrocoma, commonly known as silverleaf horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-gray, hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Horkelia argyrocoma is a perennial herb that is adapted to arid environments and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
